str2: Come hither, come, hither, an exclamatory word. From deuro and an imperative form of eimi; come hither!
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Vocative Masculine Plural
str2: From a derivative of kopos; to feel fatigue; by implication, to work hard.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Vocative Masculine Plural
str2: To load, burden; pass: To be laden. From phortos; to load up, i.e. to overburden with ceremony.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 1st Person Singular
str2: To also, I too, but I. From kai and ego; so also the dative case kamoi, and accusative case kame and I, me.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: From ana and pauo; to repose (be exempt), remain); by implication, to refresh.
